io.aistac.common.data.obcache.valueholders

Class YWDHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.aistac.common.data.obcache.valueholders.YWDHolder

  • public class YWDHolder
extends java.lang.Object
    The YWDHolder Class allows for the storage and referring of Year Week Day values and can generate a key value representative of the bean.

      • DAYS_IN_WEEK

        public static final int DAYS_IN_WEEK
        The number of days in a week. Used for clarity of code when looping days in a week
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_YWD

        public static final int MAX_YWD
        An arbitrary ywd far in the future. Used when a date range wants to go on forever

      • MIN_YWD

        public static final int MIN_YWD
        an arbitrary ywd far in the past. Used when a date is needed far in the past

      • getYwdFromDays

        public static int getYwdFromDays(int noOfDays)
        calculates the YWD value of a number of days that must be under 365 days for example 18 days would be 2 weeks 4 days
        Parameters:
        noOfDays - the number of days to convert
        Returns:
        a YWDHolder key value

        Returns:

      • weeksInYear

        public static int weeksInYear(int ywd)
        Returns the maximum number of weeks for a given ywd year
        Parameters:
        ywd - the ywd of which you want the max weeks of that year
        Returns:
        the maximum number of weeks

      • add

        public static int add(int ywd,
                      int ywdInterval)
        Adds a year,week,day interval (as a ywdKey) to a date given as year,week,day (as a ywdKey), ensuring ISO 8601 week numbering is maintained and keeping days as 0-6 Mon-Sun per our system
        Parameters:
        ywd - the the year week day holder
        ywdInterval - the interval
        Returns:
        a ywd holder
